messages.title: My Pledges to you:
messages.content: I will live in the constituency. I will give you my home phone number. I will give you my email address. I will have a locally based office staffed with local people. I will hold regular, open surgeries. I will do my weekly shopping in the constituency. I will support local businesses across the constituency.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Investments in public services have brought new facilities, such as the Walton Priory Middle School and a fully built school for the future.
New NHS Dental facilities at Fillybrook House Dental Surgery.
PCSOs giving a visual policing presence on the streets alongside OWL the Online Watch Link supporting Stone Neighbourhood Watch.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: A reduction of HGVs on rural roads.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Encouraging car share and reduced traffic pollution.
To increase local jobs and reduce commuter traffic.

mentions.candidate: Jo Lewis: standing up for Rural Staffordshire

issues.economy: Sustainable development to increase local jobs.
issues.education: Improved educational facilities - new Walton Priory Middle School and other schools.
issues.environment: Retention of Green Belt land. Encouraging car share and reduced traffic pollution.
issues.health: New NHS Dental facilities at Fillybrook House Dental Surgery.

housing.content: Inappropriate housing provision and poor planning decisions by local councils.

leaflet.personalStatement: For strong local representation at national level.

images.caption: Jo Lewis - Your Labour Candidate for the Stone Constituency at the General Election in 2010.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The Labour party has invested heavily in public services, and those investments are evident around Stone.
